Award.AwardTitle: CAREER: An Integrated Hybrid Forecasting Framework for Increased Wind Power Penetration

Division.LongName: Div Of Electrical, Commun & Cyber Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
The goal of the proposed research is to develop the next generation of algorithms to achieve significant improvement in short-term wind forecasting. Our inability to accurately capture non-Gaussian uncertainty of wind in high dimensional spaces translates to low predictability; high risk and the need for expensive balancing power resources. It is thus a primary objective of the proposed research is to significantly improve wind forecasts upto 48 hours in advance, leading to enhanced dispatch, scheduling and unit commitment operations in the day-ahead electricity market.

Intellectual Merit: The proposed research will develop an integrated framework of randomized algorithms for scalable nonlinear uncertainty propagation. Algorithm output will be combined with measured on-site data in the sense of Bayesian fusion, leading to a hybrid forecasting structure. The main technical challenges are: (i) complex wind dynamics due to multiple temporal and spatial scales, turbulence and orographic effects; (ii) non-Gaussian wind uncertainty; (iii) need for scalable algorithms due to high dimensionality; and (iv) need for fusion of information arriving from multiple algorithms and heterogeneous measurement sources. The proposed framework will have the following key features to meet these challenges: (1) formulation of the wind state as a stochastic hybrid process, governed by multiple reduced order
micro and mesoscale models; (2) a novel randomized particle uncertainty propagation approach based on the method of characteristics, Markov chain Monte-Carlo and the Karhunen-Lo`eve expansion. Practical effectiveness of developed algorithms will be measured against data from two wind-farms: the Cohocton Wind Farm/NY and the Roscoe Wind Farm/TX.

Broader Impact: The proposed forecasting framework will lead to increased penetration of wind power by reducing the risks currently associated with it; and enable us to achieve our global targets of reducing dependence on fossil-fuel based electricity. The education plan includes training high school teachers in the multidisciplinary area of sustainable energy who will in turn reach thousands of students.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Due to its nature, forecasting of complex processes must occur without the aid of online data. In the current landscape of predictive analytics, there do not exist guidelines to certify the trustworthiness of forecasts, which must ultimately form the basis for system-critical decisions, including decisions related to optimal performance and proximity to failure. The key outcome of this project is a robust, scalable computational platform for forecasting complex systems that is capable of delivering trustworthy prognostics in terms of user-defined, application specific quantities of interest (QOI). It comprises of a closed-loop, adaptive Monte Carlo framework that can self-monitor its forecasting accuracy against user-prescribed thresholds in the estimation of system specific key performance indicators, e.g. fracture-length leading to structural failure. It is capable of triggering self-corrective adaptations to its constituent simulations in order to meet said estimation accuracy thresholds, thereby delivering guaranteed estimation of the future behavior of the system. Moreover, the platform has the ability to work with learning algorithms that can improve process models with the accumulation of system data over time.

 

Intellectual Merits.

The novel forecasting platform delivers guaranteed performance in terms of estimation accuracy of precisely defined system-specific quantities of interest (QOI), also known as key performance indicators. The forecasting mechanism is built around an adaptive particle approach, which may be classified under the broad umbrella of Monte Carlo methods. However, unlike existing Monte Carlo methods, which employ fixed sized particle ensembles over the entire duration of forecasting, the new approach is designed to self-monitor its performance and adaptively modify its ensemble to maintain the estimation of QOI within prescribed bounds at all times. The forecasts are intended for use in a wide range of industries, including aerospace, automotive, civil, chemical and beyond, to provide decision making support and robust system prognostics. The following are the core intellectual merits:

1.) Guarantees are developed on the basis of well-defined quantities of interest (QOI). QOI are indicators that quantify transient accuracy of the forecasting process. They are pivotal because they become the basis for triggering online ensemble adaptations during the forecasting process. 

 

2.) The platform holds its estimation accuracy within user prescribed thresholds while maintaining statistical consistency with the instantaneous true state uncertainty.

 

3.) To enact simulation adaptation rules, a rigorous optimization problem is formulated and solved. This approach allows us to manage the computational complexity of the simulations on-the-fly. By inference, we are led to a minimal particle representation of state uncertainty under prescribed bounds of accuracy. Ensemble adaptation allows both adding and removing simulations: the former is formulated as a two-layered optimization ofensemble-efficiency, while the latter aims to eliminate inconsequential simulations on the basis of their measurable relevance to state uncertainty.

 

Broader Impacts. 

The robustness, scalability, trustworthiness and versatility of the platform allows it to be applicable to a very broad range of fields. Any application that requires decision making support for a dynamically changing process will benefit from the outcomes of this work. A non-exhaustive list ensues:

a.) Decision making support for wind farms: Participation of wind farms in the so-called day ahead electricity market requires robust forecasts of available wind at the wind-farm site for a forecast window of 48 to 72 hours. The physics of wind flow is extremely complex and depends on local conditions, topography, orography, farm effects and other factors. The new particle platform is suitable for characterizing state uncertainty in the underlying complex flow models and can deliver guaranteed estimates of available power generation capability at wind farm sites.

b.) Space Situational Awareness (SSA): The ultimate objective of space situational awareness is to track all man-made objects in space, including defunct satellites and other objects classified as debris. The new adaptive particle forecasting tool provides an unprecedented capability for SSA, namely, the ability to forecast satellite/debris states with guaranteed accuracy of computation of probability of collision/conjunction between objects of interest.

c.) Electric Automobiles: Advancements and gain in popularity of electrified vehicle technologies strongly motivate work in aging characterization, state of health (SOH) estimation and remaining useful life (RUL) prediction of lithium-ion automotive batteries. Reduced order models are often employed to capture the complex chemical processes underlying battery aging. These models can be combined with the new forecasting technique to provide robust prognostics of remaining battery useful life. This can be used for improvements in battery design.

 d.) Prognostics/Reliability Assessment in Chemical and Nuclear Process Industries: Safety analysis of chemical processes and nuclear plants must forecast the underlying complex processes for very long durations of time, sometimes extending to several years. The error buildup during such prognostications can be significant, so much as to erode confidence in the obtained results. The new forecasting technique avoids these pitfalls on account of its self-corrective nature and can provide guaranteed estimates of desired prognostic metrics for highly complex chemical and nuclear processes.
